attacks.name: Shadow Steal
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each Special Energy card in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Darkness Chant
attacks.text: Count the number of Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your discard pile. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. You can't put more than 6 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon in this way.

abilities.name: Primal Pull
abilities.text: As long as Claydol is your Active Pokémon, each player's Evolved Pokémon pays Colorless more Energy to use its attacks.

attacks.name: Muddy Eye
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of basic Energy cards attached to Claydol and the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Dark Celebi
rules: This Pokémon is both GrassDarkness type.

attacks.name: Dark Provide
attacks.text: Attach up to 1 Grass or Darkness Energy card from your hand to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mass Destruction
attacks.text: Both Electrode and the Defending Pokémon are now Knocked Out. If Electrode has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Flutter Trick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card. Your opponent discards the card you chose.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Breaking Sound
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bass Control
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunderous Roar
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extra Draw
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-ex in play, search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to Heracross. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Jirachi
rules: This Pokémon is both Psychic Metal type.

attacks.name: Make a Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) If you do, put 1 damage counter on Jirachi. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Overzealous
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-ex in play, each of Machamp's attacks do 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brick Smash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chakra Points
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Metagross
rules: This Pokémon is both Psychic Metal type.

abilities.name: Metal Juncture
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Metal Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Squared Attack
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Healing Shower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Milotic from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may remove all damage counters from all of your Pokémon and your opponent's Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex).

attacks.name: Distorted Wave
attacks.text: Before doing damage, remove 3 damage counters from the Defending Pokémon (all if there are less than 3).

abilities.name: Crust
abilities.text: Any damage done to Pinsir by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Push Aside
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 Basic Pokémon or Evolution card you find there. Your opponent puts it at the bottom of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Supernatural Power
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Heal Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Heal Dance Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

abilities.name: Crush Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If not, put the card back on your deck. This power can't be used if Walrein is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mystic Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Psychic Energy in play.

attacks.name: Chime
attacks.text: Search your opponent's discard pile for a Supporter card and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's discard pile.)

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Splash
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Darkness Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Silver Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Metal Load
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Metang.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Sunny Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Rain Castform. (Any cards attached to Rain Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Rain Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Scattered Shower
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Draw up to 5 cards.

attacks.name: Rainy Day Blues
attacks.text: If Low Pressure System is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Ninetales by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Fruition
attacks.text: Move 1 Energy card attached to Tropius to another of your Pokémon and remove 4 damage counters from that Pokémon (all if there are less than 4).

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Rain Castform, or Sunny Castform and switch it with Snow-cloud Castform. (Any cards attached to Snow-cloud Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Snow-cloud Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Flurries
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: White Snow
attacks.text: If Magnetic Storm is in play, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Deep Sleep
abilities.text: As long as Relicanth is your Active Pokémon, a player flips 2 coins for each of his or her Pokémon that is Asleep between turns. If either coin is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Sunny Castform. (Any cards attached to Sunny Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Sunny Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Sunshine
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Sunburn
attacks.text: If High Pressure System is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Magnetic Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Metal Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beldum is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Metal Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Beldum.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: If Beldum has any Energy attached to it, Beldum's Retreat Cost is 0.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Sunny Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Forecast
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card and play it. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Coral Glow
attacks.text: Draw a number of cards up to the number of your opponent's Basic Pokémon in play. (You can't have more than 10 cards in your hand in this way.)

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Ice Wall
abilities.text: Any damage done to Glalie by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon with any Special Energy cards attached to it is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Heavy Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Fast Feet
abilities.text: Dodrio can retreat even when it is Asleep or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Dodrio.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Dodrio can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Cling
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Gloom the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. If Gloom has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jigglypuff from your hand onto Igglybuff (this counts as evolving Igglybuff), and remove all damage counters from Igglybuff.

attacks.name: Set Song
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and a basic Energy card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Energy Grounding
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, when any of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by your opponent's attacks, you may use this power. Choose a basic Energy card discarded from the Knocked Out Pokémon and attach it to Lanturn. You can't use more than 1 Energy Grounding Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Lanturn. If you do, this attack's base damage is 90 instead of 50.

attacks.name: Loving Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent has in his or her hand.

attacks.name: Sweet Temptation
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cracking Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: If Machoke is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Machoke is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Power Heal
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Medicham. After doing damage, remove 1 damage counter from Medicham.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Metal Ball
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: If Metang has any Energy attached to it, Metang's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Super Icy Wind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Upper Hand
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Power Diffusion
abilities.text: As long as Rhydon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all damage done by attacks to all of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Tail
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: The Hula-la
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, both the Defending Pokémon and Spinda are now Confused.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Spinda.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rainbow Star
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each type of basic Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Swalot. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Swalot's, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Long Tentacle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Metal Ball
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Clamperl by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cyndaquil.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Feebas and put it on Feebas. (This counts as evolving Feebas.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 30 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machop.

attacks.name: Double Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Meditite (remove 1 if there is only 1).

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Minus Energy
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent returns that card to his or her hand.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Plus Energy
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to any of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Growth Spurt
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Seedot.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Shadow Crush
attacks.text: You may discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Shuppet. If you do, your opponent discards 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Core Guard
abilities.text: If Staryu has any Psychic Energy attached to it, damage done to Staryu by any attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Splash About
attacks.text: If Surskit has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

abilities.name: Freefloating
abilities.text: If Tentacool has no Energy attached to it, Tentacool's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Voltorb. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage for each damage counter on Totodile.

attacks.name: Wail
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Vulpix and put it on Vulpix. (This counts as evolving Vulpix.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Ancient Technical Machine [Ice]
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name) in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Ancient Technical Machine [Ice].

attacks.name: Ice Generator
attacks.text: Discard all of your opponent's Trainer cards in play. If you do, prevent all effects, including damage, done to the Pokémon using this attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Ancient Technical Machine [Rock]
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name) in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Ancient Technical Machine [Rock].

attacks.name: Stone Generator
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of them and put those cards back into his or her hand.

data.name: Island Cave
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Whenever any player attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to Water Pokémon, Fighting Pokémon, or Metal Pokémon, remove any Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

data.name: Ancient Tomb
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Don't apply Weakness for all Pokémon in play (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name).

data.name: Ancient Technical Machine [Steel]
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name) in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Ancient Technical Machine [Steel].

attacks.name: Steel Generator
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Poké-Power or Poké-Body, choose up to 2 basic Energy cards attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and attach them to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Desert Ruins
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
At any time between turns, each player puts 1 damage counter on his or her Pokémon-ex with maximum HP of at least 100.

data.name: Life Herb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). Remove all Special Conditions and 6 damage counters from that Pokémon (all if there are less than 6).

data.name: Magnetic Storm
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Any damage done by attacks from Psychic Pokémon and Fighting Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Kyogre ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Mark of Antiquity
abilities.text: As long as Kyogre ex is your Active Pokémon, each player's Groudon ex and Rayquaza ex can't attack.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Super Tidal Wave
attacks.text: You may show your hand to your opponent. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card in your hand. After doing damage, shuffle the Energy cards back into your deck.

data.name: Steven's Advice
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw a number of cards up to the number of your opponent's Pokémon in play.
If you have more than 7 cards (including this one) in your hand, you can't play this card.

data.name: Metagross ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Metal Reversal
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. If you do, this attack does 40 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Extra Comet Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, Extra Comet Punch does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.name: Groudon ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Mark of Antiquity
abilities.text: As long as Groudon ex is your Active Pokémon, each player's Kyogre ex and Rayquaza ex can't attack.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Crushing Mantle
attacks.text: You may discard from your hand as many Energy cards as you like. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Regice ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Crystal Body
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, except damage, done to Regice ex by the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Freeze Lock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards from his or her hand to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

data.name: Ninetales ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Intense Glare
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Ninetales ex.

data.name: Regirock ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Healing Stone
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Regirock ex.

attacks.name: Tonnage
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Regirock ex does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Registeel ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Registeel ex by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Wave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Vileplume ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Block Dust
abilities.text: As long as Vileplume ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Special Formula
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Wigglytuff ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
